Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, with slightly ribbed exterior, covered with a red slip and elaborated with a painted cream-coloured straight band and a v-shaped slash, with remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a list of articles.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.123)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87635) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87635)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 145 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
